intro: Barleria lanceolata subsp. lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red, arranged in dense spikes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
